::: {#about-me style="text-align: center;"}
I'm a senior researcher and data scientist in the [sport psychology lab](https://www.sportwissenschaft.uni-konstanz.de/schueler/schueler/research/sport-psychology-lab/){.external target="_blank"} at the University of Konstanz, Germany. My interestes include human motivation, effort, and performance in basic and applied research. I passionately use R for data science and in my general workflow.
:::

::: {.callout-tip icon="false"}
## {{< iconify fluent megaphone-loud-16-filled >}} Out Now: The Handbook of Boredom

::: columns
::: {.column width="65%"}
With contributions from boredom researchers across various disciplines, this book provides a unique and comprehensive exploration of boredom.

What's inside:

-   Foundations: Overview of a multitude of theoretical, conceptual, historical, and methodological aspects of boredom.
-   Correlates: Exploration of the properties of boredom and its links to self-control, mind-wandering, flow, and aggression.
-   Contexts: Insights into boredom in various life domains and its role for health, well-being, and aesthetic experience.

Bonus:

The final chapter is a collective effort of all contributors, offering a panoramic view of the field and outlining its future directions.

<a class="btn btn-success rounded-pill" href="https://www.routledge.com/The-Routledge-International-Handbook-of-Boredom/Bieleke-Wolff-Martarelli/p/book/9781032221861" target="_blank" role="button"> Check it out {{< iconify bi box-arrow-up-right >}}</a>
:::
